intro: Panarica tardiflora, commonly known as the late-flowering panarica, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom late in the growing season, typically from late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
